required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Randomized Comparison of Catheter-based Strategies for Interventional Access Site Closure During Transfemoral Transcatheter Aortic Valve Implantation
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Comparison of Catheter-based Strategies for Interventional Access Site Closure During Transfemoral Transcatheter Aortic Valve Implantation

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to evaluate the clinical efficacy of 2 different vascular closure device (VCD) strategies during transfemoral transcatheter aortic valve implantation (TAVI). The study hypothesizes that the choice of one over the other VCD in patients undergoing transfemoral TAVI may demonstrate relevant differences in the rate of peri-procedural complications and effectiveness of vascular closure.

detailed_description.textblock: Use of a plug-based VCD in patients undergoing transfemoral TAVI as compared to a suture-based VCD.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Investigator-initiated, single-center, prospective, open-label randomized controlled trial

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of in-hospital access-site or access-related vascular injury according to the VARC-2 definition
primary_outcome.description: Rate of in-hospital access-site or access-related vascular injury according to the VARC-2 definition

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of access-site or access-related vascular injury
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of access-site or access-related vascular injury

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of major access-site or access-related vascular injury
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 7 days and at 30 days
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of major access-site or access-related vascular injury

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of minor access site or access-related vascular injury
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 7 days and at 30 days
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of minor access site or access-related vascular injury

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of access-site or access-related vascular injury, access-site or access-related bleeding and VCD failure according to VARC-2 criteria
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 7 days and at 30 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of access-site or access-related vascular injury, access-site or access-related bleeding and VCD failure according to VARC-2 criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: death attributed to access-site or access-related complications
secondary_outcome.description: death attributed to access-site or access-related complications

secondary_outcome.measure: Unplanned vascular surgery and / or use of endovascular stent or stent-graft or other endovascular interventions at the puncture site
secondary_outcome.description: Unplanned vascular surgery and / or use of endovascular stent or stent-graft or other

secondary_outcome.measure: access-site or access-related disabling/life- threatening bleeding according to BARC
secondary_outcome.description: access-site or access-related disabling/life- threatening bleeding according to BARC

secondary_outcome.measure: access-site or access-related major bleeding according to BARC
secondary_outcome.description: access-site or access-related major bleeding according to BARC

secondary_outcome.measure: access-site or access-related minor bleeding according to BARC
secondary_outcome.description: access-site or access-related minor bleeding according to BARC

secondary_outcome.measure: Need for blood transfusion for access-site or access-related bleeding or vascular complications
secondary_outcome.description: Need for blood transfusion for access-site or access-related bleeding or vascular complications

secondary_outcome.measure: Total number of blood transfusions because of access-site or access-related bleeding
secondary_outcome.description: Total number of blood transfusions because of access-site or access-related bleeding

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of vascular closure device success, defined as the ability of a closure device strategy to obtain hemostasis
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of vascular closure device success, defined as the ability of a closure device strategy to obtain hemostasis

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of vascular closure device failure, defined as failure of a closure device strategy to achieve hemostasis with the need for an alternative treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of vascular closure device failure, defined as failure of a closure device strategy to achieve hemostasis with the need for an alternative treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to hemostasis, defined as the time from VCD application to complete hemostasis
secondary_outcome.description: Time to hemostasis, defined as the time from VCD application to complete hemostasis

secondary_outcome.measure: Need and number of additional unplanned VCDs
secondary_outcome.description: Need and number of additional unplanned VCDs

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent diameter stenosis of vascular access vessel on post-procedural angiography
secondary_outcome.description: Percent diameter stenosis of vascular access vessel on post-procedural angiography

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patients with an indication for transfemoral TAVI as judged by the local heart team.
2. Transfemoral access route and a commercially-available transcatheter aortic valve is selected by the local heart team.
3. The patient is willing to provide written informed consent and comply with protocol- specified follow-up evaluations.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Vascular access site anatomy not suitable for percutaneous vascular closure.
2. Vascular access site complications prior to the TAVI procedure.
3. Known allergy or hypersensitivity to any VCD component.
4. Unstable active bleeding/ bleeding diathesis or significant unmanageable anemia.
5. Absence of computed tomographic data of the access site before the procedure.
6. Systemic infection or a local infection at or near the access site.
7. Life expectancy of less than 6 months due to non-cardiac conditions.
8. Patient cannot adhere to or complete the investigational protocol for any reason.
9. Pregnant or nursing subjects.
10. Participation in any other interventional trial.
